title: Bookjacket, "Bookjacket for "Prolegomena to the Study of Greek Religion" by Jane Harrison, Meridian Books", 1955
medium: Lithography in brown, black, tan and white ink on white shiny wove paper
signed: Signed in printed brown ink, front cover lower right: lustig.
inscribed:
Printed in white ink, front cover upper right: Prolegomena/to the study/Religion; lower left: MERIDIAN BOOKS. Printed in black ink, front cover upper right: Greek; center right: JANE HARRISON. Printed in brown ink, upper right: of; lower margin: published by the Noonday Press/Sewn-bound for durability MG 3 $1.95.

Printed vertically in black ink, spine: PROLEGOMENA TO THE STUDY OF GREEK RELIGION; printed horizontally in black ink, spine lower margin: MG 3. Printed vertically in brown ink, spine: HARRISON. Printed vertically in white ink, spine: MERIDIAN BOOKS.

Printed in white ink, back cover left center: Prolegomena/to the study of/Greek Religion. Printed in brown ink, back cover left center: by JANE HARRISON. Printed in black ink, back cover lower half: Until the publication of Jane Harrison’s monumental/Prolegomena, a whole phase of Greek religious life was/unknown to the modern world. By studying ancient arti-/facts and rituals, Miss Harrison was able to demonstrate/that, prior to the rise of the Olympian pantheon, darker/and more primitive cults had been the religion of Ancient/Greece. This established, it became possible to trace the/history of Greek religion in detail, from primitive rite to/Orphic mysteries. This modern interest in myth owes/much to this book, and its reissue at this time makes a/primary source available once again to student and/general reader./All Meridian Books are Smyth-Sewn for Durability.
creditline: Gift of Tamar Cohen and Dave Slatoff
description:
Book cover design featuring from left to right: back, spine, and front cover. Entire cover is beige with black, white, and brown design and text. Front cover features title in upper right corner. Title is written in serif type and split into three lines. Each word of title is in front of an amorphous form reminiscent of a piece of torn paper. First line of title features word Prologomena in white in front of brown form. Second line features words "to the study of" with "to" and "the study" in white text behind black forms and "of" in brown text behind white form. Third line features "Greek" in black text in front of white form and "Religion" in white in front of brown form.

About half of page height down is author's name in black serif caps: JANE HARRISON.

Along bottom are two lines of text. Top line: in white, MERIDIAN BOOKS; in brown, "published by The Noonday Press". Second line: in red, "Sewn-bound for durability" and "MG 3 $1.95". Along right side is a sideways signature reading "lustig."

Spine features title in black serif text, author's last name in brown serif caps, and publisher in bold white sans-serif. Below, in black, "MG 3".

Back cover features title in three lines of white serif text above author's name in brown serif caps. Below is paragraph with book description. Along bottom is phrase in black italic serif text, "All Meridian Books are Smyth-Sewn for Durability."
